results.title: Skin: its structure and function
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Bruce D. Hoffman
results.brief_description: Examines the structural components of skin and describes its principle functions, providing examples of well known applications of skin structures and function, and micrographs of cell structure. Introduces some of the problems of skin and the basic elements of skin care.

results.title: Skin: it's all around you
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins Productions and Stephen Wallen
results.brief_description: Teaches the anatomy of the skin and its functions - how it protects, how it heals itself, how it is constructed, and how to care for it. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Skin of the earth
results.creator_credit: Frank Rijavec, Film and Television Institute (W.A.) and Excalibur Nominees
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
John Thomson, a retired forester from Western Australia, and a committed conservationist gives his view on the destruction of the Karri forests and the subsequent effects on the land in Western Australia. His views are reiterated by Norman Lockyer, a farmer and by Dr. Chittleborough who failed in his attempt to put through a comprehensive State Conservation Strategy. Although largely pessimistic in its outlook the program does suggest that attitudes are changing to the hitherto wasteful and destructive forestry and agricultural practices.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Rijavec, Film and Television Institute (W.A.) and Excalibur Nominees

results.title: Skin flick (E)
results.creator_credit: Gazzo Films, Millivres, Suziki Azihiro, Stance and Bruce LaBruce
results.brief_description: WARNING: THIS IS A CENSORED R-RATED VERSION OF AN ORIGINAL X-RATED PORNOGRAPHIC VIDEO. MANY SCENES ARE HEAVILY EDITED. PLEASE NOTE THAT CINEMEDIA ACCESS COLLECTION CANNOT LOAN X-RATED MATERIAL. Bruce LaBruce is increasingly queer cinema’s most maverick filmmaker, not only producing films that defy the conventions of mainstream Hollywood but also creating queer and bisexual characters who are heretical to the homosexual mainstream itself. “Skin Flick” is a pornographic film that allows itself to experiment with both representation and the techniques of film and video. Continuing LaBruce’s fetishising of skinheads, “Skin Flick” is about a group of fascist youths who spend their time having sex with one another when they are not bashing homosexuals and people of colour. The film contrasts the aggression and violence of the skinheads with the bourgeois emptiness of a mixed-race gay couple. After being raped and tortured by the skins, the couple turn the table and extract their revenge. However, they find that the pleasure of violence is addictive. “Skin Flick”, in the highly censored version that appears on this videotape, loses some of the power that it achieved in the original in which the highly stylised pornographic sex scenes allowed the viewer to contrast fantasy from reality. Paradoxically this version is more morally ambivalent since without the aesthetics of porn, the narrative of “Skin Flick” comes to the fore and we are unsure how much of the skinhead’s racism, aggression and homophobia we are meant to identify with.

results.title: Skin deep
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Government Film Unit, Norman Laird and Bill Veitch
results.brief_description: Illustrates the work of the Peter McCallum Clinic in Launceston, Tasmania, with particular reference to the treatment of cancer by X-ray machine and cobalt bomb. The central character is a patient with early cancer who finds that early treatment leads to cure.

results.title: Skilled hands and sure feet
results.creator_credit: York Television Centre, Alex MacKay and Anthony Perris
results.brief_description: Modern equipment and techniques in industry necessitate the wearing of safety gloves and boots, to prevent accidents happening. Stresses the need for supervision to prevent carelessness. Shows testing of clothing.

results.title: Skilled fingers
results.brief_description: Pleasure in Pots: The Deichmann’s family pottery in Sussex, New Brunswick, is shown. Sweater Specialists: Indian women of Cowichan, British Columbia, knit sweaters for outdoorsmen. Garden of Buildings: On his estate in Prince Edward Island, Lt. Col. E.W. Johnstone builds scale model replicas of famous castles and cathedrals.

results.title: Skilled craftsmen: five Australians
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A lot of people consider craft a hobby. Something which is undertaken as a source of relaxation and self fulfilment. Many people, however, treat the crafts as a professional livelihood. This film shows the lifestyle of five of these people, each illustrating a different facet of the crafts: Joe McBain, a blacksmith; David Wright, a stained glass artist; Lilija Duks, a weaver; Greg Wain and Victoria Howlett, potters. Narrated by Rod Mullinar
